<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="47%"></TD>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="47%"></TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="left" valign="top"><B>One Year Preferred Pricing Agreement for <BR>
D&#038;B Risk Management Solutions (07-05)</B>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top"><IMG src="w30972w3097201.gif" alt="(D&#038;B LOGO)"></TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center"><DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 1pt; width: 100%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>This Preferred Pricing Agreement for D&#038;B Risk Management Solutions (&#147;PPA&#148;) is subject to the PPA Terms and Conditions set forth below in addition to the existing D&#038;B Master Agreement between
Customer and D&#038;B that was signed June&nbsp;17, 2002. Upon acceptance of this PPA by both parties, this PPA shall constitute an &#147;Order&#148; under the existing Master Agreement. Customer, by signing
below, acknowledges receipt of the D&#038;B Product &#038; Service Pricing Guide. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the Master Agreement, this Order constitutes a binding commitment for
the term of this Order, and neither party may terminate this Order for convenience.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="62%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="33%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">Effective Date
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top"><U><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS">March&nbsp;19,<br>
2006</FONT></U></TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center"><DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 1pt; width: 100%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>PPA Terms and Conditions</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PPA Term: 1&nbsp;year from Effective Date; (referred to herein as a &#147;Contract Year&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Customer shall have access to all products and services listed on attached Appendix&nbsp;A (&#147;Included Services&#148;), subject to the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In consideration of Customer&#146;s payment of the PPA Fee for each Contract Year, Customer shall be entitled to receive an unlimited amount of Included Services, subject to usage limits on selected
products and services included within the Included Services (which limits are referred to as &#147;Product Usage Limits&#148;), determined by reference to the applicable pricing set forth below (subject to
Customer&#146;s band discount set forth below);
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any use of Included Services in excess of the applicable Product Usage Limits during a particular Contract Year shall be billed to Customer at the above referenced pricing, including applicable
band discount;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The use of Included Services under this Agreement applies to Customer as it exists today, and may be used only to support Customer&#146;s U.S. business, and may be used by Customer&#146;s U.S. divisions
and wholly owned subsidiaries that are identified on a &#147;Schedule of Locations of Service and Customer Related Companies&#148; attached hereto and executed by the parties and that are not currently
eligible to receive included Services under an existing agreement with D&#038;B (&#147;Included Entities&#148;) to support their respective U.S. businesses, provided Customer is liable for such Included Entities&#146;
compliance with the PPA and Master Agreement. Any change to Customer via merger or acquisition shall require a written addendum between D&#038;B and Customer to reflect such change, which addendum
shall include the applicable revised PPA Fee schedule. Future acquisitions by Customer of, or future acquisitions of Customer by, companies with a D&#038;B credit information contract
(&#147;Acquired/Acquiring Companies&#148;) shall not be included in this Agreement. Acquired/Acquiring Companies shall continue to receive D&#038;B services pursuant to the terms and conditions of the respective
D&#038;B credit information contract (&#147;Credit Contract&#148;) and shall not be included as an Included Entity under this PPA, until the expiration of such Credit Contract and the execution of an addendum to
this PPA as referenced above;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any use of Included Services by Customer&#146;s affiliates other than Included Entities shall be the subject of a separate, mutually agreed amendment to this PPA; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer&#146;s use of D&#038;B products and services other than Included Services, if any, shall be the subject of separate Orders executed by the parties, each of which shall be subject to, and
incorporate by reference therein, the terms of the Master Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*In the event the parties agree to renew this Order under this PPA, the PPA Fee for the next Contract Year shall be equal to (a)&nbsp;the PPA Fee for such year, plus (b)&nbsp;50% of the amount, if any, by
which Customer&#146;s actual usage in Contract Year 1 exceeded
<U>three (3)</U> times the PPA Fee for Contract Year 1.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer&#146;s actual usage for a particular Contract Year and the PPA Fee for the subsequent Contract Year shall be determined by D&#038;B by reference to the above referenced pricing, including
applicable band discount and communicated to Customer within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the end of the applicable Contract Year. Payment for such subsequent Contract Year shall be due within thirty
(30)&nbsp;days after Customer&#146;s receipt of invoice.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PPA Fees include the Annual Service Fee, and are non-refundable, and unused amounts may not be carried over to subsequent Contract Years.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event Customer does not renew this Order prior to or on the expiration date, Customer may continue to receive Services, provided that Customer will pay D&#038;B&#146;s then current published
pricing (subject to Customer&#146;s discount associated with the prior Contract Year PPA Fee set forth herein) for such Included Services for the sixty day period following the expiration date.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Dun &#038; Bradstreet, Inc. (&#147;D&#038;B&#148;) and the customer named on the attached Order (&#147;Customer&#148;) agree
that D&#038;B shall make available to Customer business information services (&#147;Services&#148;), which may
include information (&#147;Information&#148;); computer programs or applications (including those accessed
remotely), documentation and media (collectively, &#147;Software&#148;); and other services, subject to this
Master Agreement (&#147;Agreement&#148;). The Services subject to this Agreement are identified in Orders
entered into from time to time by D&#038;B and Customer. No obligation to furnish or to pay for a
particular Service arises under this Agreement until D&#038;B accepts an order and any attachments
thereto placed by Customer. All accepted orders and their attachments (collectively, the
&#147;Order(s)&#148;) for Services are subject to this Agreement, and the terms of such Orders are
incorporated by reference in this Agreement. Subject to paragraph 10.2, this Agreement continues in
force even though no Order may then be outstanding. The Services will also be made available to
Customer&#146;s U.S. parent and to U.S. companies that are subsidiaries, divisions or affiliates,
wholly-owned or controlled by Customer and that are identified on a &#147;Schedule of Locations of
Service &#038; Customer-Related Companies&#148; schedule attached to such Order and signed by the parties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>1.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Licenses</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D&#038;B grants to Customer a non-exclusive, non-transferable license (&#147;License&#148;) to use and display
the Information and Software (in object code format only) constituting each D&#038;B product specified
in an Order, subject to the limitations contained in this Agreement and such Order. D&#038;B retains
all ownership rights (including copyrights and other intellectual property rights) in the Services,
in any form, and Customer obtains only such rights as are explicitly granted in this Agreement and
such Order. The Services will include a custom model developed by D&#038;B through the use of D&#038;B and
Customer information. To the extent such model is customized for Customer, the customized model
shall be owned by Customer; provided that (i)&nbsp;Customer grants D&#038;B a license to use such model in
connection with its provision of Services to Customer hereunder, (ii)&nbsp;Customer&#146;s ownership of the
customized model does not (x)&nbsp;include ownership of any D&#038;B information, techniques, processes,
methods, expertise, or other intellectual property included therein (which collectively remain D&#038;B
intellectual property) or (y)&nbsp;affect D&#038;B&#146;s ability or rights with respect to the use of such D&#038;B
information, techniques, processes, methods, expertise, or other intellectual property for the
purpose of developing custom models for other customers for any purpose, and (iii)&nbsp;Customer shall
not license, sell, distribute or otherwise make available such custom model to any third party,
other than those third parties to which Customer may make Information or Software available
pursuant to the first sentence of paragraph 2.2.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each License and Order is for a term, beginning on the date of the Order, of 12&nbsp;months, unless
another term is specified in the Order. D&#038;B may extend the term for an additional period, in its
discretion, while the parties are engaged in renewal discussions. Any such extension shall be
subject to this Agreement. Each License or Order may be renewed as set forth in the Order and by
mutual written agreement and payment of renewal fees and applicable product and service fees (the
initial term and any renewal period for an Order or License constitute &#147;the Term&#148; for such Order or
License).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Software &#147;Updates&#148; (i.e., minor enhancements, additions, and substitutions to Software,
including corrections and bug fixes) are provided at no additional fee, if available. &#147;Upgrades&#148;
(i.e., modifications, additions or substitutions that result in a substantial change, improvement
or addition to Software), if available, are provided for an additional fee, if applicable. The
determination of whether a matter involves an Update or an Upgrade is within the sole discretion of
D&#038;B. All Updates and Upgrades obtained by Customer are subject to this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Telephone and email based software support is available during the Term of an Order for the
currently licensed Software versions, and only if Customer has installed all Updates received.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>2.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Restrictions on Use</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Information and Software are licensed for Customer&#146;s internal use only and (i)&nbsp;only at the
points of service specified in the Order; (ii)&nbsp;only for the frequency of use or total number of
users set forth in the Order; and (iii)&nbsp;subject to any other restrictions set forth in the Order.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer will not provide Information or Software to others, whether directly in any media or
indirectly through incorporation in a database, marketing list, report or otherwise, or use or
permit the use of Information to generate any statistical or other information that is or will be
provided to third parties (including as the basis for providing recommendations to others); use or
permit the use of Information to prepare any comparison to other information databases that is or
will be provided to third parties; or voluntarily produce Information in legal proceedings; except
that Customer may provide Information or Software to Representatives as defined below, in response
to regulatory requests, or as otherwise required by law. Customer shall: (i)&nbsp;maintain the
Information in strict confidence, including by restricting disclosure of the Information solely to
those of its employees, consultants, agents and advisors (collectively, &#147;Representatives&#148;) with a
need to know and not allowing it to be disclosed, through negligence or otherwise, to third
parties, (ii)&nbsp;advise Representatives who receive the Confidential Information of their obligations
hereunder and assume full responsibility for any breach by them of such obligations, (iii)&nbsp;use the
Confidential Information only in furtherance of the business relationship described in Paragraph&nbsp;1
above, and (iv)&nbsp;take all steps to ensure that no unauthorized persons have access to Confidential
Information and that all persons having access to Confidential Information refrain from any
unauthorized disclosure.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer will not attempt to access, use, modify, copy, reverse engineer, or otherwise derive
the source code of Software.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon reasonable notice and during regular business hours, Customer will permit D&#038;B to inspect
the locations at, or computer systems on which, Information and Software are used, stored or
transmitted so that D&#038;B can verify Customer&#146;s compliance with this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer will be responsible for any direct damages or lost profits incurred by D&#038;B as a result
of Customer&#146;s breach of this paragraph 2.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>3.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Copying</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer will not copy, download, upload or in any other way reproduce Information or Software
except for (i)&nbsp;creating a reasonable number of copies of Information in any format for internal use
only in accordance with this Agreement and not for general internal distribution; and (ii)&nbsp;making
one copy of Information and of Software for internal archival purposes.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>4.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>D-U-N-S Numbers</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-U-N-S Numbers are proprietary to and controlled by D&#038;B. D&#038;B grants Customer a non-exclusive,
perpetual, limited license to use D-U-N-S Numbers solely for identification purposes and only for
Customer&#146;s internal business use. Where practicable, Customer will refer to the number as a
&#147;D-U-N-S Number&#148; and state that D-U-N-S is a registered trademark of D&#038;B.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>5.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Third Party Services</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer may engage a third party to process or host Information (the &#147;Processor&#148;) provided
that the Processor and D&#038;B enter into a D&#038;B Processor&#146;s Agreement before any Information or
Software is provided to the Processor.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Third parties that provide Information to D&#038;B for use in providing the Services are intended
third party beneficiaries of paragraphs 8 and 11.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>6.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Payment</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer will pay D&#038;B in accordance with the Order. Prices and product descriptions are those
set forth in the Order, or, if not included in the Order, in the applicable pricing and product
policies made available to Customer in hard copy or on any D&#038;B Internet site, which policies are
incorporated herein. A late payment charge of the lesser of 1<FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>% per month or the highest lawful
rate may be applied to any outstanding balances until paid.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer will pay any applicable taxes relating to this Agreement, other than taxes based on
D&#038;B income and franchise &#151; related taxes.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For certain Orders for a committed volume or usage represented by an upfront payment by
Customer, Customer may be entitled to &#147;carry over&#148; portions of unused volume or usage upon renewal.
In addition, if Customer&#146;s usage exceeds the committed amount, such excess usage shall be billed
at a specified &#147;overrun&#148; rate. Such carryover and/or overrun rate, if applicable, will be
determined in accordance with the Order, or, if not included in the Order, in
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">the applicable pricing and product policies made available to Customer in hard copy or on any D&#038;B
Internet site.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If Customer&#146;s pricing with respect to a particular Order is based on Customer&#146;s expected volume
or usage as indicated on such Order and Customer does not meet such volume or usage levels,
Customer will pay D&#038;B a &#147;true-up amount&#148; based on the pricing applicable to the volume or usage
actually utilized by Customer.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>7.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Compliance with Law</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">7.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer will not use Information as a factor in establishing an individual&#146;s eligibility for
(i)&nbsp;credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes, or (ii)
employment. In addition, Customer will not use any Service to engage in any unfair or deceptive
practices and will use the Services only in compliance with applicable state, local, federal or
foreign laws or regulations, including laws and regulations regarding telemarketing, customer
solicitation (including fax and/or e-mail solicitation), data protection and privacy.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>8.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Disclaimers</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">8.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Though D&#038;B uses extensive procedures to keep its database current and to maintain accurate
data, Customer acknowledges that the Information will contain a degree of error and that Customer
is responsible for determining that the Information is sufficiently accurate for Customer&#146;s
purposes. If the Information is not sufficiently accurate for Customer&#146;s purposes, then Customer
must so notify D&#038;B, in writing, within 15&nbsp;days after receipt of such Information. D&#038;B will, at its
option, either correct the inaccuracy at D&#038;B&#146;s expense or refund any amounts paid relating to the
unusable Information.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">8.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ALL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED ON AN &#147;AS IS,&#148; &#147;AS AVAILABLE&#148; BASIS. OTHER THAN AS EXPLICITLY STATED
IN THIS AGREEMENT, D&#038;B DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING ANY WARRANTIES OF
ACCURACY, COMPLETENESS, CURRENTNESS, MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. D&#038;B DOES
NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE AND DISCLAIMS ANY WARRANTY OR
REPRESENTATION REGARDING AVAILABILITY OF A SERVICE, SERVICE LEVELS OR PERFORMANCE. D&#038;B WILL NOT BE
LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS OR INJURY ARISING OUT OF, IN WHOLE OR IN PART, D&#038;B&#146;S CONDUCT IN PROCURING,
COMPILING, COLLECTING, INTERPRETING, REPORTING OR DELIVERING SERVICES.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>9.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Copyrights and Other Proprietary Rights</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">9.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer acknowledges that Information and Software are proprietary works of D&#038;B and comprise:
(i)&nbsp;works of original authorship, including compiled Information containing D&#038;B&#146;s selection,
arrangement and coordination and expression of such Information or pre-existing material it has
created, gathered or assembled; (ii)&nbsp;trade secret and other confidential information, including
information that derives value or potential value from not being readily known or available; and
(iii)&nbsp;information that has been created, developed and maintained by D&#038;B at great expense, such
that misappropriation or unauthorized use by others for commercial gain would unfairly and/or
irreparably harm D&#038;B or reduce D&#038;B&#146;s incentive to create, develop and maintain such information.
Customer will not knowingly commit or permit any act or omission that would contest or impair D&#038;B&#146;s
proprietary and intellectual property rights in Information and Software or that would cause the
Information or Software to infringe the proprietary or intellectual property rights of a third
party. Customer will reproduce D&#038;B&#146;s copyright and proprietary rights legend on all copies of
Information and Software which are so marked when received. Customer will be responsible for any
direct damages or lost profits incurred by D&#038;B as a result of Customer&#146;s breach of this paragraph
9.1.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">9.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer and D&#038;B will not (i)&nbsp;use any trademark, service mark or trade name of each other or
any of their affiliated companies, except that D&#038;B and its affiliates may include Customer&#146;s trade
names in the data base of business information included within the Services it offers to Customer
and others or otherwise as permitted by law, or (ii)&nbsp;publish any press releases regarding this
Agreement or any Order.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">9.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D&#038;B will treat all information that Customer designates in writing to be proprietary in the
same manner as D&#038;B treats its own proprietary information. D&#038;B agrees not to use such identified
proprietary information except for the purposes of performing its obligations to Customer and for
internal analytical purposes (i.e., analyzing such data to improve D&#038;B&#146;s products and services).
Such proprietary information shall not include information that (i)&nbsp;is or becomes a part of the
public domain through no act or omission of D&#038;B; (ii)&nbsp;was in D&#038;B&#146;s lawful possession prior to
Customer&#146;s disclosure to D&#038;B; (iii)&nbsp;is lawfully disclosed to D&#038;B by a third-party with the right to
disclose such information and without restriction on such disclosure; or (iv)&nbsp;is independently
developed by D&#038;B without use of or reference to the proprietary information.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">9.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D&#038;B represents and warrants to Customer that, to D&#038;B&#146;s knowledge, the Software and Information,
when used in accordance with this Agreement, do not violate any existing U.S. copyrights, patents,
trademarks, or other intellectual property rights of any third party. The foregoing warranty does
not apply to the extent Customer modifies the Software or Information in any way or combines the
Software or Information with material from third parties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>10.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Termination</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of material breach (including, without limitation, an assignment in violation of
paragraph 13.2 hereof) by Customer or D&#038;B, the non-breaching party may immediately terminate this
Agreement or particular Orders without prior notice. In addition, D&#038;B may terminate this Agreement
or particular Orders upon 30&nbsp;days&#146; prior written notice; provided that if D&#038;B terminates this
Agreement or particular Orders other than for cause, D&#038;B will refund to Customer the unused balance
of any amounts paid under the relevant Orders. If Customer terminates this Agreement or particular
Orders due to a material breach by D&#038;B pursuant to this section, D&#038;B will refund to Customer the
unused balance of any amounts paid under the relevant Orders so long as such material breach is
proved in any judicial proceeding.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If Customer has no Orders in effect during a period of six consecutive months, then D&#038;B may
terminate this Agreement at the end of such six-month period by sending written notice to Customer.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The provisions set forth in paragraphs 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10.3, 10.4, 10.5, 11 and 12 will
survive the termination of this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If, without D&#038;B&#146;s written permission, Customer continues after termination to obtain Services
covered by a terminated Order or Agreement, Customer will be liable to D&#038;B for the undiscounted
fees for such Services in effect on the date of such termination.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon termination of a Term with respect to particular Information or Software, or upon receipt
of Software or Information that is intended to supersede previously obtained Software or
Information, unless D&#038;B instructs Customer otherwise, Customer will immediately delete or destroy
all originals and copies (other than archival copies permitted by paragraph 3) of the Information
or Software, and upon request, provide D&#038;B with certification thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Termination of this Agreement will result in a termination of all outstanding Orders.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>11</B>.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Limitation of Liability</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">11.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NEITHER D&#038;B NOR CUSTOMER WILL BE LIABLE FOR SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY, INCIDENTAL OR
CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING LOST PROFITS), EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES,
ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR THE DELIVERY, USE, SUPPORT OR OPERATION OF THE SERVICES, EXCEPT
AS OTHERWISE PROVIDED HEREIN.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">11.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D&#038;B&#146;s LIABILITY FOR A PARTICULAR CLAIM WILL NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNT PAID BY CUSTOMER TO D&#038;B FOR
THE PARTICULAR INFORMATION OR SOFTWARE UPON WHICH THE CLAIM IS BASED OR $20,000, WHICHEVER IS
GREATER. ANY CLAIMS AGAINST D&#038;B WILL BE BROUGHT, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THIS AGREEMENT, WITHIN 12
MONTHS OF DISCOVERY OF THE FIRST OCCURRENCE GIVING RISE TO SUCH CLAIMS, BUT IN NO CASE MORE THAN
TWENTY-FOUR (24)&nbsp;MONTHS FROM THE FIRST OCCURRENCE, OR SUCH CLAIMS WILL BE FOREVER BARRED.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>12.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Choice of Law; Disputes</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">12.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement is governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New
Jersey, without regard to choice of law provisions. Any disputes arising out of this Agreement
that cannot be resolved by the parties will be brought in state or federal court located in Newark,
New Jersey.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">12.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each party shall bear its own costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys&#146; fees
incurred in any action to enforce the obligations of the other party under this Agreement, however,
Customer will reimburse D&#038;B for all costs and expenses (including all reasonable attorneys&#146; fees
and costs as well as all damages incurred) in D&#038;B&#146;s enforcement of the Customer-Related Companies
compliance with this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>13.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Miscellaneous</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">13.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement, all Orders, addenda and schedules, and D&#038;B&#146;s published policies and procedures
referred to herein and in effect from time to time, including those published on D&#038;B&#146;s web site,
constitute the entire agreement between D&#038;B and Customer regarding the Services. Unless an Order
states otherwise, where there is a conflict between the terms of any addenda or schedules and this
Agreement, the terms of the Agreement shall control with respect to the Services. Where there is a
conflict between the terms of any Order and this Agreement, the terms of the Order shall control
with respect to the Services set forth in such Order and solely to the extent of the conflict. Any
amendments of or waivers relating to this Agreement or any Order must be in writing signed by both
parties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">13.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement binds and inures to the benefit of the parties and their successors and
assigns, except that neither party will assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of
the other party; however, either party may assign the Agreement (i)&nbsp;to an affiliate controlled by,
controlling or under common control with that party; provided such affiliate is not a direct
competitor of D&#038;B, or (ii)&nbsp;in connection with a merger or consolidation (so long as the assignment
is to the newly merged or consolidated entity) or the sale of substantially all of its assets (so
long as the assignment is to the newly merged or consolidated entity). Notwithstanding the
foregoing, with respect to an assignment pursuant to (ii)&nbsp;above, the non-assigning party may
terminate this agreement upon thirty (30)&nbsp;days written notice if such party objects to the
assignment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>14</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U><B>Indemnification</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D&#038;B shall defend or settle at its expense any claim, suit or proceeding arising from or
alleging: (a)&nbsp;infringement of any existing U.S. copyrights, patents, trademarks, or other
intellectual property rights of any third party (&#147;Intellectual Property Right&#148;) by Service or part
thereof furnished under this Agreement; (b)&nbsp;property damage or personal injury, including death,
directly caused by or personal injury, including death, directly caused by or sustained in
connection with the performance of the Services or any activities of D&#038;B in connection therewith;
and (c)&nbsp;a breach of the warranties and representations made by D&#038;B in this Agreement. D&#038;B shall
indemnify and hold Customer harmless from and pay any and all losses, costs and damages, including
royalties and license fees, reasonable counsel fees attributable to such claim, suit or proceeding.
Customer shall give D&#038;B prompt notice of, and the parties shall cooperate in, the defense of any
such claim, suit or proceeding, including appeals, negotiations and any settlement or compromise
thereof, provided that the Customer shall approve the terms of any settlement or compromise.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If any Service or part thereof furnished under this Agreement, including without limitation
Software, system design, equipment or Documentation, becomes or in the Customer&#146;s or D&#038;B&#146;s
reasonable opinion is likely to become, the subject of any claim, suit, or proceeding arising from
or alleging infringement of, or in the event of any adjudication that such Service or part thereof
infringes on, any Intellectual Property Right, D&#038;B, at its own expense shall take the following
actions in the listed order of preference: (i)&nbsp;secure for the Customer the right to continue using
the Service or part thereof; or (ii)&nbsp;if efforts are unavailing, replace or modify the Service or
part thereof to make it non-infringing; provided, however, that such modification or replacement
shall not degrade the operation or performance of the Service
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Pursuant to 17 CFR 240.24b-2, confidential portions of this document have been omitted; such
confidential portions have been filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the
&#147;Commission&#148;) pursuant to a Confidential Treatment Application filed with the Commission. The
redacted portions of this exhibit are marked by a &#091;***&#093;.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>TWENTY THIRD AMENDMENT TO SERVICE AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Twenty Third Amendment (this &#147;Amendment&#148;) to the Service Agreement dated as of January&nbsp;1,
2002, as amended (the &#147;Service Agreement&#148;) is made and entered into this 18th day of December, 2006
(the &#147;Execution Date&#148;) by and between Advanta Bank Corp. (&#147;Customer&#148;) and First Data Resources, LLC
(formerly known as First Data Resources Inc.) (&#147;FDR&#148;). For good and valuable consideration, the
receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, Customer and FDR agree as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;Except as otherwise specified herein, all terms set forth in this Amendment are effective
as of January&nbsp;1, 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;In the event that this Amendment is executed by the parties on or before December&nbsp;31, 2006,
then FDR agrees to provide Customer with a &#147;Processing Fee Credit&#148; in the amount of &#091;***&#093;. The
Processing Fee Credit will be provided to Customer &#091;***&#093;, and &#091;***&#093;. Anything in this Amendment or
the Service Agreement to the contrary notwithstanding, in the event that &#091;***&#093;, then &#091;***&#093;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;2.4 <I>(Programming Services) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby deleted and replaced
with the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">&#147;<B>2.4 </B><U><B>Programming Services</B></U><B>.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;In connection with the services provided by FDR pursuant to the terms of this Agreement,
FDR shall perform, at its expense, up to 1,000 hours of computer programming services in each
Processing Year during the Term of this Agreement after Processing Year 5 (as defined in Section
8.1)(the &#145;Free Programming&#146;). Unused hours of Free Programming from one Processing Year shall not
be carried forward into any other Processing Year.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;In addition to the Free Programming set forth in Section&nbsp;2.4(a) above, FDR agrees to make
available to Customer an additional programming credit (the &#145;Additional Programming Credit&#146;) during
the period commencing on January&nbsp;1, 2007 and ending on the earlier of (i)&nbsp;December&nbsp;31, 2011 or (ii)
the termination or expiration of this Agreement (including, without limitation, Customer&#146;s exercise
of its right to terminate this Agreement for convenience pursuant to Section&nbsp;9.2(d)). The
Additional Programming Credit is defined as a pool of &#091;***&#093;,
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">available for the period specified in the preceding sentence, that may be applied by Customer
against the fees for any computer programming service hours (including but not limited to computer
programming service hours associated with the &#145;PCF Change Report,&#146; &#145;Insurance Screens&#146; and &#145;1099
Flexibility&#146; projects which are, at the time of the execution of this Amendment, currently being
reviewed by the parties) incurred by Customer during such period which are in excess of the Free
Programming hours set forth in Section&nbsp;2.4(a) above. Subject to the provisions of this paragraph
(b), the Additional Programming Credit will expire &#091;***&#093;. Upon the conclusion of each applicable
Processing Year, Customer will be eligible to receive a credit to Customer&#146;s invoice (the
&#145;Processing Fee Credit&#146;) for any unused portion of the &#091;***&#093; Additional Programming Credit
available for such Processing Year at a rate of $125 per unused hour up to a maximum of &#091;***&#093;.
(The following examples have been provided for clarification: (A)&nbsp;If in a single applicable
Processing Year, &#091;***&#093;; (B)&nbsp;If in a single applicable Processing Year, &#091;***&#093;; and (C)&nbsp;If in a
single applicable Processing Year, &#091;***&#093;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;FDR shall charge, and Customer shall pay, $125 per hour for each hour of computer
programming services provided by FDR at the request of Customer which exceed or are not covered by
either the Free Programming or the Additional Programming Credit.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;Article&nbsp;2 <I>(Services) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby amended by the addition of a
Section&nbsp;2.9 to read as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>2.9 </B><U><B>System Optimization Project</B></U><B>. </B>At any time, but only once, during the period commencing
on January&nbsp;1, 2007 and ending December&nbsp;31, 2011, Customer may request that FDR perform a System
Optimization Analysis for Customer. The System Optimization Analysis shall consist of a review of
Customer&#146;s use of the FDR System and the Services under this Agreement with respect to Customer&#146;s
servicing of its Cardholder Account programs, and written recommendations by FDR to Customer, based
upon such analysis, which shall provide suggestions to improve Customer&#146;s efficiency in such
servicing and more effective use of the FDR System and the Services. Customer and FDR shall
mutually agree upon the specific areas of focus to be included in the System Optimization
Analysis.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Customer and FDR hereby agree that, as of the Execution Date of this Amendment, the System
Optimization Analysis described in this Paragraph&nbsp;3 of this Amendment is already in progress.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;In Paragraph (a)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;3.1 <I>(Sole and Exclusive Provider) </I>of the Service Agreement, the
first instance of subparagraph (iii)&nbsp;which is in the first sentence of Paragraph (a)&nbsp;is hereby
amended to read as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;(iii) Customer shall not agree with any third party to have such third party perform or provide,
in North America, any Core Processing Services to Customer, provided, however, that in no event
shall the provisions of this subparagraph (iii)&nbsp;be deemed to prohibit Customer, during the
remaining Term of this Agreement, from negotiating and signing with any third party any agreement
to have such third party perform or provide any services to Customer for any periods following the
expiration or termination by Customer as set forth in Section&nbsp;9.2, including termination for
convenience by Customer set forth in Section&nbsp;9.2(d) of this Agreement.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3.4 <I>(Acquisition of Portfolios or Entities Not Serviced by FDR) </I>of the Service
Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;In Section&nbsp;4.2 <I>(Price Increases) </I>of the Service Agreement, Paragraph (a)&nbsp;is hereby deleted
and replaced with the following:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">"(a) During each Processing Year after Processing Year 5, FDR may, by notice to Customer,
increase as follows only those Processing Fees set forth in Section&nbsp;IV of Exhibit &#145;A&#146; which are
associated with certain production services (as marked with a &#145;P&#146; in Section&nbsp;IV of Exhibit &#145;A&#146;);
provided, however, that FDR shall not be allowed to increase such Processing Fees at any time while
this Agreement is in effect, unless the percentage change in the Consumer Price Index (&#147;CPI&#148;)
during the calculation period described below for any applicable Processing Year is greater than
four percent (4%), in which case FDR may increase the Processing Fees which were in effect for the
immediately preceding Processing Year (the &#145;Old Year&#146;) by an amount not to exceed in the aggregate
three quarters (3/4) of the percentage change in the CPI over four percent (4%) during a period
described below, and in no event shall such increase be less than 0% nor more than 6%. For
purposes of this paragraph, the CPI shall be the index compiled by the United States Department of
Labor&#146;s Bureau of Labor Statistics, Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) having a
base of 100 in 1982-84, using that portion of the index which appears under the caption &#145;All
Items.&#146; The CPI percentage shall be communicated to Customer within forty-five (45)&nbsp;days of the
end of each applicable Processing Year. The CPI will be expressed as a percentage determined by
simple average over a twelve (12)&nbsp;month period of the prior year. Any such adjustment to the
Processing Fees will be effective on the first day of each Processing Year.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;4.5 <I>(Minimum Fees) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby deleted and replaced
with the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">&#147;<B>4.5 </B><U><B>Minimum Fees</B></U><B>.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(a)&nbsp;In each Processing Year during the Term of this Agreement after Processing Year 5 (as defined
in Section&nbsp;8.1), Customer will require and shall pay FDR for processing services sufficient

Processing Fees&#146;). FDR shall calculate the total Processing Fees paid by Customer in respect of
services performed during each Processing Year (the &#145;Total Annual Processing Fees&#146;) within ninety
(90)&nbsp;days after the end of each Processing Year and will, after ten (10)&nbsp;days written notice to

Minimum Processing Fees for the Processing Year exceed the Total Annual Processing Fees for the
Processing Year (such amount a &#145;Minimum Fee Shortfall&#146;).

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;Article&nbsp;4 <I>(Payment for Services) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby amended by the

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>4.9 </B><U><B>New Product Incentive</B></U><B>. </B>In each Processing Year, after Processing Year 5, during the

charges associated with the New Product). For purposes of this Section&nbsp;4.9, a New

written amendment after the commencement of Processing Year 6.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;Sections&nbsp;8.1 <I>(Term) </I>and 8.2 <I>(Renewal) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby deleted and
replaced with the following:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>8.1 </B><U><B>Term</B></U><B>. </B>Except as otherwise provided for in this Article&nbsp;8, the Term of this Agreement
shall continue in effect for an additional period of five (5)&nbsp;Processing Years (Years 6, 7, 8, 9
and 10), commencing on January&nbsp;1, 2007 and expiring on December&nbsp;31, 2011 (hereinafter referred to
as the &#145;Renewal Period&#146;). For purposes of this Agreement, a Processing Year means each twelve (12)
month period commencing on the first day of January and ending on the last day of December.
Processing Year 6 of the Term shall commence on January&nbsp;1, 2007 and continue through December&nbsp;31,
2007.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>&#147;8.2 </B><U><B>Extension</B></U><B>. </B>Upon the expiration of the Renewal Period, the Term of this Agreement
shall automatically be extended for one (1)&nbsp;period of one (1)&nbsp;Processing Year (the &#145;Extension
Period&#146;) unless either party gives the other party written notice at least six (6)&nbsp;months prior to
the termination date of the Renewal Period that the Agreement will not be extended.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;9.2 <I>(Termination by Customer) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby amended by the
addition of a subsection (d)&nbsp;to read as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;(d) For Customer&#146;s convenience upon the conclusion of Processing Year 8 (December&nbsp;31, 2009),
provided that Customer gives FDR written notice, on or before September&nbsp;30, 2009, of its intention
to so terminate this Agreement.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;The first sentence of Section&nbsp;9.6 <I>(Deconversion) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby
deleted and replaced with the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Upon the termination for any reason or the expiration of this Agreement, Customer and FDR
shall mutually, expeditiously and in good faith proceed to agree upon and document a Deconversion
project plan, which the parties contemplate may involve an up to eighteen (18)&nbsp;month time frame for
completion and implementation.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;14.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;11.2 <I>(Customer&#146;s Representations) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby amended
by the addition of a paragraph (e)&nbsp;to read as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;(e) Customer represents and warrants that the account records and/or address lists in reliance
upon which FDR will provide mailing services to Customer, together with any other mail matter
provided to FDR, satisfy the requirements established by the United States Postal Service (&#145;USPS&#146;)
for First-Class&nbsp;Mail presorted and automation rates, including but not limited to the Move Update
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">requirements for addresses. In that regard, Customer has provided to FDR an executed copy of
Postal Service Form&nbsp;6014, <I>Certification of Move Update Compliance</I>, or its current equivalent and
agrees to update it as necessary to maintain its accuracy. If the Customer is not the mail owner,
it is the Customer&#146;s responsibility to obtain Postal Service Form&nbsp;6014 or equivalent assurances
from the mail owners so that it can provide the required Postal Service Form&nbsp;6014 or equivalent to
FDR for the mail matter it requests FDR to process. Customer acknowledges that in reliance upon the
forgoing, FDR will certify to the USPS, on behalf of Customer, that Customer&#146;s mail complies with
all applicable USPS standards for receiving discounts and Customer agrees that it will be liable
for any revenue deficiencies assessed with respect to mailings on its behalf. Customer further
agrees that, if at any time during the life of this contract Customer discontinues taking the steps
needed to satisfy the USPS requirements identified above in this paragraph, Customer will notify
FDR in advance in writing. Customer also agrees that, if at any time during the life of this
contract FDR requests Customer to confirm its compliance with USPS requirements, it will do so in
writing within ten (10)&nbsp;days after FDR&#146;s request and, if it does not, FDR in its discretion may
cease processing Customer&#146;s mail as discount mail and Customer is responsible for any increased
costs.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;15 Section&nbsp;13.2 (b) (<I>Performance Reports) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby deleted and
replaced with the following:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>&#147;13.2 (b) </B><U><B>Performance Reports. </B></U>The Performance Standards set forth in Exhibit &#147;C&#148; are
divided into two Categories. FDR&#146;s performance with respect to the Performance Standards in each
Category during the just concluded calendar month will be managed as follows: i) Category I &#151;
Achievement by FDR of &#091;***&#093; Category I Incentive Level Performance Standards and &#091;***&#093; Category II
Standard Performance Standards constitutes a Successful Month for which Customer will pay FDR a
service level agreement (&#147;SLA&#148;) incentive payment equal to &#091;***&#093;; failure by FDR to achieve &#091;***&#093;
of the Category I Performance Standards constitutes a Failed Month for which FDR will pay Customer
an SLA remedy payment equal to &#091;***&#093;; and ii) Category II &#151; Achievement by FDR of &#091;***&#093; Category
II Incentive Level Performance Standards and &#091;***&#093; Category I Standard Performance Standards
constitutes a Successful Month for which Customer will pay FDR and SLA incentive payment equal to
&#091;***&#093;; failure by FDR to achieve &#091;***&#093; of the Category II Performance Standards constitutes a
Failed Month for which FDR will pay Customer a remedy payment equal to &#091;***&#093;. All SLA incentive
payments payable by Customer and all SLA remedy payments payable by FDR with respect to any month
will be netted. Any resulting net SLA incentive payment will be billed and any resulting net SLA
remedy payment will be credited to Customer on Customer&#146;s next monthly invoice following quarter
end. &#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;16.&nbsp;Section&nbsp;14.10 <I>(Audit) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby deleted and replaced with the
following:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>14.10 </B><U><B>Audit</B></U><B>. </B>At least annually during the remaining Term of this Agreement, FDR will
provide
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->7<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">for a third party to perform an audit of the electronic data processing environment maintained by
FDR to provide the services set forth in this Agreement. Such audit will conform to the Statement
of Auditing Standards No.&nbsp;70, for Type II reviews (&#145;SAS-70,&#146; or any successor substitute statement
adopted by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants). FDR shall provide Customer
with a copy of the SAS-70 report associated with such audit, as well as any plans for addressing
deficiencies therein, if Customer requests a copy in writing. In addition, Customer, its
authorized agents and/or its federal or state regulatory authorities may audit FDR for compliance
with this Agreement relating to the confidentiality and security of information relating to
Customer&#146;s customers, subject to any reasonable confidentiality requirements of FDR. FDR agrees to
comply with all reasonable requests (including without limitation requests to visit FDR&#146;s
facilities) in connection with any such audit; provided that (a)&nbsp;FDR shall be given at least thirty
(30)&nbsp;days&#146; prior written notice of such audit, (b)&nbsp;such audit shall be performed during FDR&#146;s
normal business hours, and (c)&nbsp;such audit shall be performed at Customer&#146;s expense.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;17.&nbsp;Article&nbsp;14 of the Service Agreement is hereby amended by the addition of Sections&nbsp;14.19
and 14.20 to read as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;<B>14.19 </B><U><B>FDR Insurance</B></U><B>. </B>FDR currently has and will maintain, at a minimum, the insurance
coverage set forth in Exhibit&nbsp;E to this Agreement. FDR agrees to name Customer as an additional
insured on those policies so indicated in Exhibit&nbsp;E. FDR will provide to Customer, at such times
as Customer may reasonably request, certificates of evidence of insurance setting forth the types
and amounts of insurance which FDR then has in effect.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>&#147;14.20 </B><U><B>Regulation&nbsp;AB Compliance. </B></U>At the request of Customer, FDR shall, and shall
cause any subcontractors providing services hereunder to, use reasonable efforts to cooperate with
Customer in order for Customer to meet its compliance requirements under Regulation&nbsp;AB (17 C.F.R.
Sections&nbsp;226.1100-1123 as may be amended from time to time relating to Asset Backed Securities) to
the extent that the Services provided pursuant to the this Service Agreement may be covered by such
requirements and are disclosed to FDR by Customer. In no event, however, shall FDR be required to
incur additional costs in connection with this cooperation unless Customer and FDR mutually agree
in advance on a written plan for the reimbursement of such costs by Customer.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;18.&nbsp;Exhibit &#147;A&#148;, Section&nbsp;IV <I>(Processing Fee Definitions/Prices) </I>of the Service Agreement
is hereby deleted and replaced with the price schedule set forth in Attachment I hereto, which is
hereby incorporated into this Amendment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;19.&nbsp;Exhibit &#147;A&#148;, Section&nbsp;IX of the Service Agreement is hereby deleted in its entirety.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20.&nbsp;Exhibit &#147;C&#148; <I>(FDR Performance Standards for Customer) </I>of the Service Agreement is hereby
deleted and replaced with a new Exhibit &#147;C&#148; to read as set forth in Attachment II hereto, which is
hereby incorporated into this Amendment.
</DIV>

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">This element identifies the charge for the number of accounts that are assigned a behavior
score and/or are processed by the Adaptive Control System (ACS). The Behavior Score is a
portfolio management tool that summarizes the level of risk an individual account
possesses. The Adaptive Control System is a decision support tool that performs automatic
actions for account management in the following areas. Delinquent collections, Overlimit
collections, Authorizations, Credit line management, Reissue, Warning bulletin management.

    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top"></TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">VERIFICATION &#151; ISSUING
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Customer located at FDR are accessed for Address Verification.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top"></TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">293</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">LOST OR STOLEN REPORT &#151; FDR ENTERED
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each report of a lost or stolen Transaction Card from the Cardholder of Customer which is
processed by FDR&#146;s Fraud Management Voice Operations. Reports entered on-line immediately
change the external status and block authorization requests on the Cardholder Account.
Service includes lost/stolen reports received via collect call, telegram and telex.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/report</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">SPECIAL RMS REPORT PREMIUM
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">The additional charge to Customer for each non-standard or unique RMS report provided to
Customer at Customer&#146;s request.

Report or the equivalent report.

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each payment which is processed through the FDR Payment Defender/Available Funds
decisioning system allowing Customer to limit the risk on such Account associated with the
increased &#145;open to buy&#146; created by a payment. This system places a hold (float)&nbsp;on all or
a portion of the payment for a specified number of days, restricting the &#145;open to buy&#146;
available to the Cardholder.
</TD>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Following receipt by FDR of a request on the Mastercom/VISA RFC System for a facsimile of
a Ticket previously acquired by Customer and stored away from FDR&#146;s premises, FDR will (a)
mail a request to the custodian of the Ticket and (b)&nbsp;utilizing a Mastercom/VISA RFC
workstation located at FDR&#146;s premises forward an image of such Ticket to the requesting
party.
</TD>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Following receipt by FDR of a request on the Mastercom/VISA RFC System for a facsimile of
a Ticket previously acquired by Customer and stored at FDR, FDR will retrieve the Ticket
or a facsimile thereof and forward an image of such Ticket to the requesting party
utilizing a Mastercom/VISA RFC workstation located at FDR&#146;s premises.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">MASTERCOM/VISA RFC ISSUER RETRIEVAL
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">FDR will (a)&nbsp;receive, via a Mastercom/VISA RFC workstation located at FDR&#146;s premises, a
copy of a Ticket image previously requested from an Acquirer by Customer or a
notification from MasterCard/VISA that the Acquirer has failed to return a Ticket
image within the time period permitted by MasterCard/VISA rules, (b)&nbsp;mail a
copy of the Ticket image or notification to Customer and (c)&nbsp;transmit Customer&#146;s
acceptance or rejection of each Ticket to MasterCard/VISA following receipt of
Customer&#146;s written instructions on acceptance
or rejection of such Ticket.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

CFR 240-24b-2; such confidential portions have been filed separately with the Commission pursuant to a Confidential Treatment

    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">ON-LINE CREDIT BUREAU REPORT REQUEST
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">The transmission by Customer of credit application or existing account information via
video display terminals at Customer&#146;s location to any of the supported principal credit
bureaus with which Customer has established a written relationship that is in effect at
all times during the term of this Agreement in order to determine the credit worthiness of
an applicant/account. Anything in this Agreement to the contrary notwithstanding, in the
event that Customer&#146;s relationship(s) with all of the principal credit bureaus supported
pursuant to this Agreement should be terminated at any time during the term of this
Agreement, then FDR&#146;s obligation to provide On-Line Credit Bureau Report Requests shall
automatically be terminated, without penalty or financial obligation of any type or kind
to FDR, on the effective date of the termination of Customer&#146;s relationship(s) with such
principal credit bureaus
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">An entry made by an employee of Customer to reassign collection accounts to alternative
employees&#146; work queues.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/transaction</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">2629</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">DES-PIN ACCESS CHARGE
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">This element identifies the charge for start-up of the Data Encryption Standard Personal
Identification Number (DES PIN) product.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/unit</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">2666</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">FIRST CLASS MAIL &#151; DELINQUENCY STATEMENT
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each Delinquency Statement which is prepared by FDR for delivery to the USPS for mailing.

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD colspan="13" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top">2670</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">STANDARD DATABASE MANAGEMENT FEE</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" valign="top" align="left">The monthly charge for the standard DataChoiceSM Services, which consist of giving
Customer access to a system with the ability to create, store, maintain and execute
scheduled and ad hoc queries from numerous available data sources. These data sources
include current and historical master file data and transaction and statement detail.
Access to the system presently is via an internet browser. The basic unit of measure used
in connection with the DataChoiceSM Services is the Database Management Unit, a unit of
measure equivalent to a gigabyte of data. The standard DataChoiceSM Services includes the
following components:<br>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" valign="top" align="left">(i)&nbsp;updating of Customer selected, subject oriented sections (each, a &#145;Section&#146;) of the
DataChoiceSM data model;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" valign="top" align="left">(ii)&nbsp;access to such Sections of the DataChoiceSM data warehouse model;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" valign="top" align="left">(iii)&nbsp;access to standard templates developed for specific analysis results;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">This element identifies the charge for using the NM* 759, Demand ACH transaction,
subtransaction 02. NM*759, subtransaction 02 is the ACH transaction that enables you to
post a one-time cash advance directly to your cardholder&#146;s checking or saving account.

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each initiation of a Demand ACH transaction to post a one-time payment directly from
Cardholder&#146;s checking or saving Account.

bureaus with which Customer has established a written relationship that is in effect at
all times during the term of this Agreement in order to determine the credit worthiness of
an applicant/account. Anything in this Agreement to the contrary notwithstanding, in the
event that Customer&#146;s relationship(s) with all of the principal credit bureaus supported
pursuant to this Agreement should be terminated at any time during the term of this
Agreement, then FDR&#146;s obligation to provide On-Line Credit Bureau Report Requests shall
automatically be terminated, without penalty or financial obligation of any type or kind
to FDR, on the effective date of the termination of Customer&#146;s relationship(s) with such
principal credit bureaus.

services in connection with the authorization of a

statused lost or stolen and which is automatically
identified and reported to an online work queue.

    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each transaction entered on-line using FDR&#146;s

    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">AIRLINE ITINERARY ON STATEMENT</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Up to four (4)&nbsp;legs of detailed airline itinerary
displayed on a Cardholder Statement.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/statement</TD>
</TR>

    <TD colspan="11" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">2813&nbsp;
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">COMPANY CARD SERVICE MAIL PREPARATION</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">The preparation of each set of reports prepared for
mailing in the USPS to a company designated by Customer in
connection with those services provided by FDR in order to
support commercial card accounts of Customer. For purposes of
this Agreement, a set of reports shall mean all reports of a
single company which are placed in a single envelope for
mailing.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/set of reports</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

stored on-line which reprint is delivered to a Cardholder of
Customer at Customer&#146;s request.
</TD>

authorization inquiry results in a Voice
Authorization Inquiry, Merchant request
for assistance or a security action,

authorization and the appropriate voice
and/or security action charge as provided
in this Agreement.

<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="left" valign="top">4001&nbsp;
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">P
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">PLASTICARD STANDARD EMBOSSING SERVICES</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each plastic
card for which FDR
has mechanically
raised personalized
characters prepared
at the request of
Customer based upon
Customer&#146;s Product
Control File or a
CRT entry request
made by an employee
of Customer, or in
response to a
receipt of a
magnetic tape or
transmission from
Customer of
embossing files in
a format defined by
FDR. Includes up
to three lines of
alpha-numeric font
and one line of OCR
font on a &#147;.030&#148;
plastic, the
recording and
verifying of data
on the Transaction
Card&#146;s magnetic
stripe (high or low
coercivity), the
tipping of the
plastic through the
placement of a
contrasting color
plastic film on the
raised embossed
characters, the
printing of
variable card
carrier information
on a
Customer-specified
card carrier form
and the insertion
of a card carrier
containing a merged
Cardholder plastic
into an envelope,
and the electronic
matching of plastic
to the related card
carrier. An FDR
generic card
carrier and
envelope are
included at no
charge, provided,
however, that due
to increased
inventory cost, if
Customer uses its
own materials,
Customer will not
be entitled to
receive a price
discount. FDR will
generate embossing
information based
upon Customer&#146;s
Product Control
File (or, at
Customer&#146;s option,
receive embossing
information via
tape from
Customer), use such
information to
prepare the
embossed plastic
and mail the
embossed plastic on
behalf of Customer
to its Cardholder
at the Cardholder&#146;s
then current
address.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/plastic embossed</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="11" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="left" valign="top">4002&nbsp;
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">PLASTICARD STANDARD EMBOSSING SERVICES</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each plastic
card for which FDR
has mechanically
raised
personalized
characters prepared
at the request
of Customer
based upon
Customer&#146;s Product
Control
File or a CRT entry
request made by an
employee of
Customer, or in
response to a
receipt of a
magnetic tape
or transmission
from Customer of
embossing files in
a format defined
by FDR. Includes
up to three lines
of
alpha-numeric font
and one line of OCR
font on a
&#147;.030&#148; plastic, the
recording and
verifying of data
on the
Transaction Card&#146;s
magnetic stripe
(high or low
coercivity), the
tipping of the
plastic through the
placement of
a contrasting color
plastic film on the
raised
embossed
characters, the
printing of
variable
card carrier
information on a
Customer-specified
card carrier form
and the insertion
of a card carrier
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/plastic embossed</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="11" valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

pieces pulled out
of normal process.
Cards will be
mailed the same day
as the request is
received if
received by 10:00
a.m. CTZ.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/ Card</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
