    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">PLASTICARD SPECIAL
EMBOSSING &#151; TWO DAY
MAILING
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Rush servicing of
cards from hard
copy (fax or mail)
reports or
requests. Includes
manual embossing,
carrier printing
and hand inserting,
and applies to any
pieces pulled out
of normal process.
Cards will be
mailed the second
day following the
date the request is
received if
received by 5:00
p.m. CTZ.
</TD>

    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">WAREHOUSE REWORK HANDLING FEE</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">The charge
associated with
managing of a
Customer&#146;s product
that was received
at FDR&#146;s warehouse
that does not meet
FDR specifications
and needs to be
reworked.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/unit</TD>

of statement
information on

    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">RJE/NDM-AUTH ONLY MERCHANT</DIV></TD>

MasterCom<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">&#174;</SUP> or Visa<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">&#174;</SUP> Resolve Online for those issuers
and acquirers who wish to file a case with
MasterCard or Visa. The service also includes
receiving documentation electronically through
MasterCom<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">&#174;</SUP> or Visa<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">&#174;</SUP> Resolve Online for those issuers
and acquirers who have a case being filed against
them. During both the sending and receiving process,
FDR will provide notification to its clients of case
rulings as MasterCard or Visa communicates them to
FDR.

LOCAL LINE INQUIRY
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each audio
response unit (ARU)
authorization
service provided to
a Merchant of
Customer by the use
of a touch-tone
telephone and local
line
telecommunication
services. Customer
shall pay FDR for
each instance
during which FDR
has electronic
contact with a
Merchant of
Customer and
receives the
Merchant number.
In addition, if an
audio response unit
authorization
inquiry results in
a voice inquiry,
Merchant request
for assistance or a
security action,
Customer will pay
FDR for the audio
response unit
authorization and
the appropriate
voice and/or
security action
charge as provided
in this Agreement.
If a Merchant of
Customer attempts
to use its normal
line to obtain an
authorization and
the Merchant is
unable to use such
line and uses
another line,
Customer shall pay
FDR at the rate
charged for the
line used by the
Merchant. Local
lines for
authorization
services are
available in the
cities listed
on-line under a TC-400 transaction.

    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">6606</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">POS INTERSTATE <BR>
AUTHORIZATION <BR>
INQUIRY
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each dial-up
point-of-sale
terminal inquiry
serviced by FDR for
Merchants of
Customer by the use
of a dial-up
point-of-sale
terminal and
interstate WATS
line
telecommunication
services. Customer
shall pay FDR for
each instance
during which FDR
had electronic
contact with a
Merchant of
Customer and
receives the
Merchant number.
If a Merchant of
Customer attempts
to use its normal
line to obtain an
authorization and
the Merchant is
unable to use such
line and uses
another line,
Customer shall pay
FDR at the rate
charged for the
line used by the
Merchant.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/inquiry</TD>

Customer&#146;s

    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">6626</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">INTRA FDR-PIN/AUTH
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">This element identifies the charge for normal,
intra-FDR, personal identification number (PIN)
authorization processing. Intra-FDR processing occurs
when the cardholder and merchant are processed by
different financial institutions within the First Data
System.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/Inquiry</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">6628</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">INTERCHANGE-REG CHD
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">This element identifies the charge for
processing incoming interchange authorization
requests. Incoming interchange processing occurs when
First Data processes for the cardholder, but not for
the merchant.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/Inquiry</TD>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">This element identifies the charge for processing
normal, incoming interchange personal identification
number (PIN)&nbsp;authorization requests. Incoming
interchange processing occurs when First Data
processes for the cardholder, but not for the

</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each referral authorization message handled by FDR
on behalf of Customer&#146;s Merchant.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">7003</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">HOT CALL &#151;<BR>
LOST/STOLEN
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each Hot Call where the Cardholder Account is
statused Lost or Stolen. FDR will instruct the
Merchant to pick up the card and, at Customer&#146;s option
based upon predefined criteria, FDR shall investigate
and dispatch the police to the Merchant location.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/call</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">7004</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">HOT CALL &#151; CARD
PICKUP
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each Hot Call where the Cardholder Account is
statused as credit related. FDR will instruct the
Merchant to pick up the card.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/call</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each entry or change made to the MasterCard
Warning Bulletin, MasterCard Authorization File or
VISA Warning Bulletin by FDR personnel; the account
listing and region(s) shall be as dictated by Customer.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/transaction</TD>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">7010</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">STATUS CODE CHANGE<BR>
&#151; MANUAL ENTRY BY FDR
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">A change by FDR personnel to the external status
code or credit limit of a Cardholder Account of
Customer made upon Customer&#146;s request.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/transaction</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">7011</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">PKI DIGITAL <BR>
CERTIFICATE
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">This is a digital identity that is required to
access FDR web based products.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/unit</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">7013</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">HOT CALL &#151; POSITIVE
ID CHECK
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each Hot Call where an authorization attempt
exceeds Customer&#146;s predetermined parameters. The
presenter of Customer&#146;s card is checked for positive
ID and the card is checked for counterfeiting.
Positive ID checks can be initiated for: (i)
excessive activity (number of transactions and/or
dollar amount) per account per day, (ii)&nbsp;first use of
a new or reissued card exceeding a specified amount,
and/or (iii)&nbsp;excessive dollar amount for a single
purchase as specified by Customer.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/call</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">7014</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">HOT CALL &#151;<BR>
EXCESSIVE TRANS
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each Hot Call where an authorization attempt
exceeds Customer&#146;s predetermined parameters. The
presenter of Customer&#146;s card is checked for positive
ID and the
card is checked for counterfeiting. Positive ID checks
can be initiated for: (i)&nbsp;excessive activity (number
of transactions and/or dollar amount) per account per
day,
(ii)&nbsp;first use of a new or reissued card exceeding a
specified amount, and/or (iii)&nbsp;excessive dollar amount
for a single purchase as specified by Customer.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/call</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>



<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96"></TD>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">1</SUP></TD>

platform on the
CRF. The S0 CRF
record displays all
items that
qualified to be
included in a
statement package;
however, not all
items qualified are
actually mailed due
to weight and white
space management.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/ account per<BR>
segment</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">7167</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">CRF STATEMENTS DMM <BR>
DECISIONING
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">This item counts
the number of
qualified statement
records that came
from the First Data
DMM platform on the
CRF. The S1 CRF
record displays all
items that
qualified to be
included in a
statement package;
however, not all
items qualified are
actually mailed due
to weight and white
space management.<BR>

Services-Cardholder
Pricing allows Customer
the ability to set,
change and monitor
pricing parameters
(including but not
limited to annual
percentage rate, penalty
fees, minimum payment
calculations and annual
charges) on a Cardholder
Account automatically at

built by Customer.

by First Data.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/ Payment<BR>

    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">7276</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">NATIONAL CHANGE OF
ADDRESS (NCOA)
SYSTEM
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">The periodic updating of
Customer&#146;s Cardholder
Account from the USPS
National Change of
Address file. The FDR
System will, once every
six (6)&nbsp;months,
electronically update
the addresses of all of
Customer&#146;s Cardholder
Accounts using this
information. At
Customer&#146;s option, FDR
will either (i)&nbsp;provide
Customer with reports
from which Customer may
enter the necessary
non-monetary
transactions to update</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">OARS 30 DAY VIEW

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Each page of
Information Delivery
Platform (IDP)
reports which is
stored by FDR for
on-line viewing and
printing by
Customer&#146;s
personnel. FDR shall
make reports
available for
reviewing for the
period of from four
(4)&nbsp;days following
daily cycle
completion to either
thirty (30), sixty
(60), seventy five
(75)&nbsp;or ninety (90)
days following daily
cycle completion, at
Customer&#146;s option.
Customer, at its
option, may elect to
utilize either or
both of the OARS
Services and/or
CD-ROM Services for
the same IDP
reports.

    <TD align="left" valign="top">The Customer
Service Application
will consist of a
template of core
customer service
functions typically
handled in an
inbound customer
service call
center, including a
graphical user
interface (GUI),
workflow engine,
rules based
decisioning and an
ad hoc reporting
tool. Use of the
Customer Service
Application will be
billed based upon
the number of
Customer&#146;s gross
Active Accounts on
file for the
applicable month,
subject to
indicated
limitations/exclusions. For purposes of
the Customer
Service
Application, &#147;Gross
Active Accounts on
File&#148; shall mean
those of Customer&#146;s
Cardholder Accounts
which generated,
during the
applicable month,
(I)&nbsp;a Cardholder
statement (whether
printed or
otherwise), (ii)&nbsp;a
Cardholder Monetary
Transaction, or
(iii)&nbsp;an
authorization
inquiry.

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 8pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">note &#147;template
available&#148; or
&#147;client customized&#148;
actions taken on an

collector
productivity. The

Application also
includes a
graphical user

workflow engine,
rules based
decisioning and an
ad hoc reporting
tool. With certain
exceptions, the
Collections
Application
includes &#147;basic
dialer interface&#148;
functionality with
most major dialers.
The Collections
Application is
billed based upon
the Average Number
of Accounts In
Collections
Application during
the applicable
month, subject to
indicated
limitations/exclusions. For purposes of
this service,
&#147;Average Number of
Accounts In
Collections
Application&#148; means
the sum of the
total number of
Cardholder Accounts
resident in the
Evolve System -
Collections
Application for
each business day
of the month
divided by the
number of business
days in such month.

    <TD width="1%"></TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">Print and Mail Prep.
11&#148; Duplex &#151; Addl.
Page Cont.

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

identifies the

prepared for
mailing. The

incremental to the

Cont. Page 1 Duplex
11&#148; Print.

(FALCON)&nbsp;SERVICES &#151;

DIALING)

    Any Cardholder

WorkCenter and

manual dialing
process that
results in any one
or more of the
following
activities in a
single 48-hour
period: outgoing/incoming
Cardholder phone
calls with a
maximum of 2
attempts within any
single 48-hour
period, CIS Memos,
Letter generation
or Account
statusing.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/ Account reviewed</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD colspan="13" nowrap valign="top" align="left" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">8523</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">PROFITSIGHT - ACTIVE ACCOUNTS
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">A neutral network based
statistical system combined with FDR
system technology and complimentary
products, e.g., ACS, TLP, ALP designed
to predict the future profitability of
an existing account by analyzing the
past transaction behavior of the
cardholder. It consists of a suite of
inter-related models that forecasts
individual components of cardholder
profitability including credit risk,
attrition risk and revenue potential.
Billing is based on the number of
transactions scored, such as auths,
payments, payment reversals, new
accounts, account transfers, and cycle
cuts.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/unit</TD>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">8556</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">PROFITNET <BR>
BENCHMARKING
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">
    ProfitNet is a joint product
offering by FDR and Argus Information
and Advisory Services Inc. The product
is a Credit Card Payment Study or
(CCPS).<BR>&nbsp;<BR>
CCPS is a study which analyzes credit
card profitability by means of a
quarterly benchmarking report (&#147;CCPS
Report(s)&#148;), with follow-up analysis
and recommendations (collectively &#147;CCPS
Services&#148;) The CCPS Services include: (A) quarterly benchmarks of customer
behavior, risk and profitability; (B)
an ongoing panel that gives detailed
point-in-time and trended information
regarding customer behavior; (C)
primary research surveys focused
specifically on activation,
utilization, and product development
opportunities; (D)&nbsp;recommendations
tailored to each End Client; and (E)
modification and enhancements to such
services from time to time.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">/Portfolio per month</TD>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B><U>ATTACHMENT II</U></B><BR><B><U>EXHIBIT C</U></b>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>FDR Performance Standards for Customer</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Category I Performance Standards</B>

</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="15%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="55%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left"><B>Financial</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Measurement</B></TD>

    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Standard</B></TD>

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Cardholder<BR>
Statements*
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Cardholder Statements will be Accurate** and will be mailed by
the end of the second business day following cycle date for 100%
of each month&#146;s cardholder statement volume. Hold and Rerun
situations primarily caused by Customer will be excluded from
this measurement.
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&#091;***&#093;

</TD>

end of the second business day following cycle date for 100% of
each month&#146;s embossed plastic orders. Hold and Rerun situations
primarily caused by Customer will be excluded from this
measurement. This measurement does not include MINT mail time.

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">* Any statementing and/or plastic actions (inserts, messages, PCF) received from Customer after

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">**For the Cardholder Statements and Letters Performance Standards, &#147;Accurate&#148; means that &#091;***&#093; of
the items are correctly processed and mailed with inserts, envelopes and forms. For the Embossing
Performance Standard, &#147;Accurate&#148; means that for &#091;***&#093; of the embossed cards the information from
the cardholder system is correctly embossed on the plastic, the card carrier is printed on the
correct form and includes the correct inserts and envelopes. Performance will be based upon
feedback from Customer and periodic audit and quality checks performed by FDR.
</DIV>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(1)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Earnings before income taxes in 2005 included a $67.7&nbsp;million gain on the transfer of consumer credit card
business related to our May&nbsp;28, 2004 agreement with Bank of America.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(2)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Earnings before income taxes in 2002 included a charge of $43.0&nbsp;million related to a ruling in the litigation associated
with the transfer of our consumer credit card business in 1998.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(3)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Our adoption of Financial Accounting Standards Board Interpretation No.&nbsp;46, <I>Consolidation of Variable Interest
Entities &#151; An Interpretation of ARB No.&nbsp;51</I>, as revised, resulted in the deconsolidation of the subsidiary trust that issued
our trust preferred securities effective December&nbsp;31, 2003. As a result of the deconsolidation of that trust, the consolidated
income statements include interest expense on subordinated debt payable to preferred securities trust beginning January&nbsp;1, 2004,
as compared to periods through December&nbsp;31, 2003 that included payments on the trust preferred securities classified as
minority interest in income of consolidated subsidiary.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(4)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For purposes of computing these ratios, &#147;earnings&#148; represent income (loss)&nbsp;from continuing operations before income
taxes plus fixed charges. &#147;Fixed charges&#148; consist of interest expense, one-third (the portion deemed representative
of the interest factor) of rental expense on operating leases, and preferred stock dividends of subsidiary trust.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DESCRIPTION>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv23</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U>Exhibit&nbsp;23</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>Consent of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Board of Directors<BR>
Advanta Corp.:

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We consent
to the incorporation by reference in the registration statements (No.&nbsp;33-60419, No.&nbsp;333-05701, No.&nbsp;333-71995, 333-74575, No.
333-92151, No.&nbsp;333-33136, No.&nbsp;333-90642 and No.
333-136724) on Form S-3 and in the registration statements
(No.&nbsp;33-32969, No.&nbsp;33-53205, No.&nbsp;33-59219,
No.&nbsp;333-18993, No.&nbsp;333-49116, No.&nbsp;333-104031, and
No.&nbsp;333-104014) on Form S-8 of Advanta Corp. and subsidiaries (the &#147;Company&#148;) of our reports dated
February&nbsp;26, 2007, with respect to the consolidated balance
sheets of the Company as of December
31, 2006 and 2005, and the related consolidated statements of income, changes in stockholders&#146;
equity, and cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2006,
management&#146;s assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting as of
December&nbsp;31, 2006 and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting as of December
31, 2006, which reports appear in the December&nbsp;31, 2006 annual report on Form 10-K of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Our report
dated February&nbsp;26, 2007, on the consolidated balance sheets of the Company as of
December&nbsp;31, 2006 and 2005, and the related consolidated statements of income, changes in
stockholders&#146; equity, and cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended December
31, 2006 refers to the Company&#146;s adoption of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.
123R, &#147;Share-Based Payment,&#148; effective January&nbsp;1, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">
/s/ KPMG LLP<BR>
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania<BR>
February&nbsp;26, 2007
</DIV>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-31.1
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>w30972exv31w1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION OF CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER PURSUANT TO RULE 302
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv31w1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;31.1</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>CERTIFICATION OF CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER<BR>
PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE<BR>
SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">I, Dennis Alter, certify that:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of Advanta Corp.;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact
or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period
covered by this report;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in
this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this
report;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and
maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and
15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure
controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made
known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this
report is being prepared;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal
control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide
reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation
of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted
accounting principles;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such
evaluation; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the
registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control
over financial reporting; and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">5.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most
recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s auditors
and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the
equivalent functions):</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect
the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information;
and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</TD>
